definition: to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable
sb with preternaturally good hearing (in fiction)/fig. a well-informed person
vehicle that gives one a free ride/(fig.) (ride on sb's) coattails/(take advantage of) an opportunity
to act according to whatever is the current outlook/pragmatic/unprincipled

sentences.english: Dear colleagues, a pleasant journey, I remember thinking of us, always come back together sometime.
sentences.chinese: 亲爱的同事，一路顺风，记得想念我们，常回来聚聚。

sentences.english: A cloak of raven feathers fluttered from his shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 渡鸦羽毛的斗篷在肩头上顺风飘动。

sentences.english: Then he got a free ride from a warm-hearted Mexican.
sentences.chinese: 于是，他搭了一位好心的墨西哥人的顺风车。

sentences.english: We stopped rowing and let the boat sail down the wind.
sentences.chinese: 我们停止划桨，让小船顺风漂动。

sentences.english: China's express delivery generally use the " downwind ", the on-site service.
sentences.chinese: 中国的快递一般用的是“顺风”，上门服务的。

sentences.english: The boat scudded along before the rising wind.
sentences.chinese: 升起了船帆，以使船顺风向航行。

sentences.english: So that our efforts for the development of your business downwind aids to navigation.
sentences.chinese: 让我们的努力为您企业的发展顺风助航。

sentences.english: The ship forged ahead under a favourable wind.
However, a tree on the coast, exposed to a constant wind from the sea, bends away from the blast.
sentences.chinese: 然而，海边的树常年受海风吹拂，总朝顺风方向弯曲。

sentences.english: May you have favorable winds on the way.
TSC made Shun-Feng brand diesel locomotive, Hsin-Ying Sugar Factory.
sentences.chinese: 台糖自制的顺风牌柴油机车。

sentences.english: This stour describes two characters from journey to the West.
sentences.chinese: 千里眼和顺风耳是《西游记》中的两个人物。

sentences.english: Latest internet news, webmaster of the eyes and ears.
sentences.chinese: 互联网最新动态新闻，站长的千里眼和顺风耳。

sentences.english: I wish you a safe journey.
He likes to travel in a ship running before the wind.
sentences.chinese: 他喜欢乘顺风疾驶的船游玩。

sentences.english: Tom went to Edinburgh by hitch-hiking.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆考搭顺风车去了爱丁堡。

definition: to go against the wind/contrary wind/a headwind
under full sail/going as fast as possible
(sitting) opposite/across (the street)/directly in front/to be face to face
to sail against the current/(fig.) to go against the flow
person/number of people/(per) capita/(a person's) head/(Tw) person whose identity is used by sb else (e.g. to create a bogus account)
